title: Basic Principles and Calculations in Chemical Engineering 8th
description:
Basic Principles and Calculations in Chemical Engineering, 8th Edition (c2012), textbook by David M. Himmelblau & James B. Riggs.

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.pearsonhighered.com/educator/product/Basic-Principles-and-Calculations-in-Chemical-Engineering/9780132346603.page" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsonhighered.com/educator/product/Basic-Principles-and-Calculations-in-Chemical-Engineering/9780132346603.page</a>
Table of Contents:
  PART I: INTRODUCTION
    01: What are Chemical Engineering and Bioengineering?
    02: Introductory Concepts
  PART II: Material Balances
    03: Material Balances
    04: Material Balances without Reaction
    05: Material Balances Involving Reactions
    06: Material Balances for Multi-Unit Systems
  PART III: Gases, Vapors, and Liquids
    07: Ideal and Real Gases
    08: Multiphase Equilibrium
  PART IV: Energy
    09: Energy Balances
    10: Energy Balances: How to Account for Chemical Reaction
    11: Humidity (Psychrometric) Charts and Their Use
  PART V: Supplementary Material
    12: Analysis Of The Degrees Of Freedom in a Steady-State Process
    13: Heats of Solution and Mixing
    14: The Mechanical Energy Balance
    15: Liquids and Gases in Equilibrium with Solids
    16: Solving Material and Energy Balances UsingProcess Simulators (Flowsheeting Codes)
    17: Unsteady-State Material And Energy Balances

FILE INFO: bookmarked, PDF (seemingly converted from EPUB; direct page links).
compressed (zipped): right-click the filename (.7z) & choose Extract to convert to PDF (40 MB); discard the .7z file (container) when done.
